page.title: 14RELIGION:ST.SYLVESTER'S
page.content: {St.Sylvester's Church}was preceded by a temporary building which was opened on{December 31st. 1879, St. {Sylvester's Day,}and was named St. Sylvester's. The{present building}was opened and dedicated on{July {28th. 1885 }by the Bishop of Ely. According to records held, the Rev John Watkins did tremendous good work for the church. It is due to his efforts that the church was built at a cost of Â£800. It was used as an{Army {Chapel}during the period 1941_1945. St Sylvester's is a{very small {church}with room for a congregation of approximately eighty four people. It is built in a{similar style to {Keeble College Oxford}with a combination of light brick and dark brick{.Three services a month}are held there. It will be the{centenary}of the church's opening in July 1985.
